citations.narrative:
The songbird enclosure had multiple @ 2-5 inch in diameter holes in the interior mesh lining the wire screen outer walls.
These holes may be an entry point for small birds to enter and become trapped between the two walls of the enclosure or
permit smaller pest rodents or predators to enter the enclosure, representing a possible risk to animal welfare. The facility
must ensure that the housing facilities are kept in good repair.
Correct by 13 September 2023.

The main sink in the kitchen, used for preparing animal feed and washing dishes, had black sticky material adhered to the
corners and around the upper edge of the basin. A large amount of black sticky material was also adhered to the door
seal of the freezer used to store frozen food for animal diets. Surfaces of food preparation and storage equipment must be
kept clean to prevent contamination and facilitate sanitation practices to ensure animal welfare. The facility must ensure
that the premises are kept clean.
Correct by 13 September 2023
This is a (1st) Re-License Inspection for a Class (“C”) license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by 11 November 2023 (60 days counted from 1st RL
Inspection) or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to
schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.150(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The songbird enclosure had multiple @ 2-5 inch in diameter holes in the interior mesh lining the wire screen outer walls. 
These holes may be an entry point for small birds to enter and become trapped between the two walls of the enclosure or 
permit smaller pest rodents or predators to enter the enclosure, representing a possible risk to animal welfare. The facility 
must ensure that the housing facilities are kept in good repair. 
 
Correct by 13 September 2023. 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The main sink in the kitchen, used for preparing animal feed and washing dishes, had black sticky material adhered to the 
corners and around the upper edge of the basin. A large amount of black sticky material was also adhered to the door 
seal of the freezer used to store frozen food for animal diets. Surfaces of food preparation and storage equipment must be 
kept clean to prevent contamination and facilitate sanitation practices to ensure animal welfare. The facility must ensure 
that the premises are kept clean. 
 
Correct by 13 September 2023 
 
This is a (1st) Re-License Inspection for a Class (“C”) license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by 11 November 2023 (60 days counted from 1st RL 
Inspection) or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to 
schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
